ref: 6250 *dāṁṣṭra ʻ fang, tusk, beard ʼ. [dáṁṣṭra -- n. ʻ tusk, fang ʼ RV., daṁṣṭrā -- f. Pāṇ. MBh.; daṁṣṭrikā -- f. ʻ tusk, beard ʼ lex.; dāḍhā -- f. ʻ tusk ʼ lex., dāḍhikā -- f. ʻ beard ʼ Mn., dāḍaka -- m. ʻ tooth ʼ lex. Semant. development ʻ fang -- tusk -- beard ʼ is possible (Rivet BSL 83, 143). But MIA. dāṭhā -- < daṁṣṭrā -- is phonet. difficult. On the other hand *dāṁṣṭra -- (with vr̥ddhi -- formation meaning ʻ pertaining to or collection of fangs ʼ (cf. A. dār below) > ʻ fang ʼ, cf. Wackernagel AiGr ii 2, 130 and 132) would in MIA. become NWPk. *dāṭṭha -- (in S. P. WPah. below), central daṁṭha -- , daṭṭha -- , amg. dāṭha -- , dāḍha -- (with simplification of consonant -- group after orig. IA. long vowel), spread of which at the cost of daṭṭha -- was favoured by clash of the latter with daṭṭha -- < daṣṭa<-> and dr̥ṣṭá -- . Possibility of further Drav. (J. Bloch BSOS v 741) or Mu. (PMWS 63) influence cannot be excluded. -- √daṁś]
Pa. daṭṭhā -- f. ʻ large tooth, fang, tusk ʼ;
Pk. daṁṭhi -- ʻ having big fangs ʼ;
